questions.title: Sustainable Fashion in Europe
questions.statement: Only a small minority of people in Europe buy sustainable fashion, which is made with less harm to people and the environment.

actionsReceived.name: frictionalert
actionsReceived.title: Friction Alert!
actionsReceived.statement: Friction alert! Wearing synthetic clothing releases microplastic fibers that end up in your environment or even in your body. Add two microplastics.

questions.title: Plants and Microplastics
questions.statement: Plants grow normally despite the presence of microplastics, while algae are affected.

questions.title: Microplastic Particle Size
questions.statement: The smallest microplastic particle found by scientists are comparable in thickness to a human hair

questions.title: Inhaling Microplastics
questions.statement: Microplastics can be inhaled.

questions.title: Global Plastic Recycling
questions.statement: Most global plastic waste is recycled.

questions.title: Dutch Laundry Habits
questions.statement: The large majority of Dutch people wash clothes at a low temperature.

actionsReceived.name: partyoutfit
actionsReceived.title: Party Outfit
actionsReceived.statement: You have a party tonight, and one of your housemates has the perfect item to complete your outfit. Take one clothing item from one of the other players.

actionsReceived.name: homeventilation
actionsReceived.title: Home Ventilation
actionsReceived.statement: You ventilated your home today. Fresh air = fewer microplastics. Remove 2 microplastics.

actionsReceived.name: thriftstore
actionsReceived.title: Thrift Store
actionsReceived.statement: You decide to bring some clothes to the second-hand clothing store. Discard one of your clothing items.

actionsReceived.name: lowlaundryload
actionsReceived.title: Low Laundry Load
actionsReceived.statement: You underfilled the washing machine--this increases friction and releases more microplastic fibres in the environment! Add two extra microplastic next time you do laundry.

actionsReceived.name: catchupshoppinghabits
actionsReceived.title: Catch up: Shopping Habits
actionsReceived.statement: Your friends are switching to natural and second-hand clothes. You rise to the challenge - good for your style and for your wallet! Gain 2 euros.

actionsReceived.name: catchuplaundryhabits
actionsReceived.title: Catch up: Laundry Habits
actionsReceived.statement: Your friends are washing at colder, shorter cycles. You also do your part - less heat means fewer fibers floating around! Remove 2 microplastic from indoor air.

actionsReceived.name: syntheticheat
actionsReceived.title: Synthetic Heat
actionsReceived.statement: You washed synthetic clothes at a very high temperature. More heat = more microplastics! Add two microplastics.

questions.title: Synthetic Clothing and Ocean Microplastics
questions.statement: Microplastics from washing synthetic clothing account for about 15% of the total microplastics present in the oceans.

questions.title: Natural vs Synthetic Clothing Comfort
questions.statement: Most people think that natural clothes are more comfortable than synthetic clothes.
